author: Staff Reporter
text:
A total of 1.25 lakh people in Madurai district have benefitted through the Chief Minister’s Comprehensive Health Insurance Scheme (CMCHIS) since its launch in 2012, the district administration has said.

In a statement, the district administration said that Rs. 197.95 crore-worth treatment had been availed by 1.25 lakh beneficiaries from both the government hospitals and the private hospitals that met the required criteria for the scheme.

Out of the 1.25 lakh people, 38,296 people were treated at Government Rajaji Hospital and other government hospitals in the district. A total of 9,545 people among the 1.25 lakh beneficiaries availed the service for diagnostic services alone.

The health insurance card under the CMCHIS had been issued to around 6.13 lakh families in the district. The district administration also said that the families with annual income of less than Rs. 72,000 per annum could apply for the card at the Collector’s office or at Government Rajaji Hospital.
title: 1.25 lakh people benefit from health insurance scheme
